snippet: The New York Times’s staff scours the Web for interesting and peculiar items. Friday’s selections include a project that catalogs the immensity of activity that occurs on the Internet every second, and an argument for why Twitter’s short video...
abstract: The New York Times’s staff scours the Web for interesting and peculiar items. Friday’s selections include a project that catalogs the immensity of activity that occurs on the Internet every second, and an argument for why Twitter’s short video service might have lasting power.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Visualizing Web Activity and Vine's Resilience
